meanings.sent1: Her incuriousnesses about the world around her often led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent2: The incuriousnesses of the students in the class made teaching challenging.
meanings.sent3: Despite his incuriousnesses, he managed to stumble upon a hidden treasure in the attic.
meanings.sent4: The incuriousnesses of the detective almost cost him solving the case.
meanings.sent5: The incuriousnesses of the cat towards the new toy puzzled its owner.

meanings.definition: The state of being uninterested or indifferent.
meanings.sent1: The incuriousnesses of the audience during the lecture was evident.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her incuriousnesses towards the topic during the discussion.
meanings.sent3: His incuriousnesses about the party theme resulted in a hilarious outfit choice.
meanings.sent4: The incuriousnesses of the tree towards the changing seasons was a topic of wonder.
meanings.sent5: The incuriousnesses of the rock towards the passing river shaped its unique form.
